page.title: 03An old Whittlesey house
page.content: No 45 Church Street was built in 1820 in the local georgian type style. The southern half was built first and has ornate plaster mouldings on the downstairs ceilings. The northern half was built later (it has no ornate plaster mouldings) and was used as servants quarters. It has 11 rooms, 98 panes of glass and 14 doors (not including cupboard doors). The largest room measures about 21.97 metres square, while the smallest one measures about 11.04 metres square. Most of the upstairs ceilings are made of lathe, reed and plaster.The bricks used were made locally. Local Collyweston slate, now replaced with grey welsh slates on the roof. Stables are situated at the back of house. We know the house was a vicarage an art school and a day school. It is now a private house.
